meta.description: Jay Naidoo, activist and Minister in Nelson Mandela's cabinet, penned the Op-Ed, "What Happens to the Covid Vaccine-Injured in South Africa?"

title: The COVID Vaccine-Injured in South Africa
cleaned_text:
Jay Naidoo is a life-long activist in South Africa. He served as a Minister in Nelson Mandela’s cabinet and General Secretary of the Congress of South African Trade Unions (COSATU). Naidoo penned the recent editorial for Biznews.com, What Happens to the Covid Vaccine-Injured?

Alec Hogg writes in the introduction: “This is a well-researched Op-Ed which flies in the face of the popular narrative and pleads for a pause to Covid vaccines; an independent and deep assessment of the data; and opening of the ears by officialdom to the calls of the vaccine injured. Given the wide and justified mistrust of Big Pharma and allegations of bureaucrat ‘capture’, Naidoo’s calls appear entirely rational.”
